column8: Eastern N. America - Massachusetts to New York, Florida, Alabama and Mississippi.
column16: Nabalus serpentarius is a PERENNIAL growing to 1.5 m (5ft).  See above for USDA hardiness. It is hardy to UK zone 5. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs) and is pollinated by Insects.  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils and prefers  well-drained soil. Suitable pH: mildly acid and neutral soils. It can grow in full shade (deep woodland) or  semi-shade (light woodland). It prefers  moist soil.

column21: Plants For A Future can not take any responsibility for any adverse effects from the use of plants. Always seek advice from a professional before using a plant medicinally.AntidoteThe plant is said to be an antidote for snake bites[207].
column22: Repellent: Plants that are said to deter but not necessarily kill various mammals, birds, insects etc.
column23: The juice of the plant repels snakes[207].
column25: Succeeds in shade or semi-shade in a moist but well-drained humus-rich neutral to acid soil[200].
column26: Seed - surface sow in a greenhouse in spring. When they are large enough to handle, prick the seedlings out into individual pots and grow them on in the greenhouse for their first winter. Plant them out into their permanent positions in late spring or early summer, after the last expected frosts.
